message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the problem of using polar codes with higher order modulation over AWGN channels. This problem falls under the domain of information theory and communication systems, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.IT and cs.COMM. The paper also proposes a new technique called bit-permuted coded modulation (BPCM), which involves applying bit permutations prior to mapping the polar code to a higher order modulation. This technique is related to signal processing and system identification, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.SI and cs.NI. Finally, the paper uses simulations and density evolution to demonstrate the performance of the BPCM technique, which involves computational methods and algorithms, covered by the sub-category cs.DS.
